variant.question: How will the power required vary with constant IAS for increasing density altitude for a propeller aeroplane in the climb?

options.text: Power required will remain unchanged.
Power required will decrease.
Power required will increase.
It is unrelated to density.

variant.question: The density altitude is 3 000 ft at an airport whose PA is 1 000 ft. What is the effect on the aircraft?

options.text: Take-off and landing performance will be unaffected.
The indicated speed at 50 kts on take-off and landing will be higher than in standard atmosphere.
The altimeter will indicate 3000 ft when the aircraft is on the ground.
Take-off and landing performance will be about the same as for an airport elevation of 3000 ft.
the altitude obtained by setting the subscale of an altimeter to QNH.
the height in the standard atmosphere at which the prevailing density occurs.
the height obtained by setting the subscale of an altimeter to QNE.
the altitude in the standard atmosphere at which the prevailing density occurs.

variant.question:
Refer to figure.

Which of the following graphs illustrate the movement of the total drag curve as density altitude decreases?

options.text: Figure 3
Figure 2
Figure 4
Figure 1

variant.question: The effect of change of ambient temperature on an aeroplane performance will be to:

options.text: Cause a decrease in the landing distance required for an increase in temperature
Cause an increase of the climb gradient for a decrease in temperature
Cause a decrease in take-off distance required for an increase in temperature
Cause an increase in the take-off ground run for a decrease in temperature

variant.question: Which of the following three speeds of a jet aeroplane are basically identical? The speeds for:

options.text: maximum climb angle, minimum glide angle and maximum range
maximum drag, maximum endurance and maximum climb angle
holding, maximum climb angle and minimum glide angle
maximum range, minimum drag and minimum glide angle

variant.question: From FL50 to 500 ft above the destination aerodrome, a multi-engined piston (MEP) aeroplane performs a steady descent, maintaining a constant speed of 120 kt IAS. During this descent, the ‘’Power Required vs. TAS’’ curve will move (1) \_\_\_\_\_ and the ‘’Power Available vs. TAS’’ curve will move (2) \_\_\_\_\_.

options.text: (1) up and right; (2) down and right
(1) down and left; (2) up and left
(1) down and right; (2) up and right
(1) up and left; (2) down and left

variant.question: A turbojet aeroplane in straight and level flight is cruising at FL290\. For a given mass and CG position, how will the high-speed buffet and low-speed buffet as an IAS vary when the flight is operated at FL330?

options.text: The low-speed buffet decreases and the high-speed buffet increases.
Both the low-speed buffet and high-speed buffet decrease.
Both the low-speed buffet and high-speed buffet increase.
The low-speed buffet increases and the high-speed buffet decreases.

variant.question: Regarding a piston engine, how will the fuel flow be affected with increasing altitude while maintaining the same power setting?

options.text: Due to decreasing air density with altitude, less fuel is required for combustion, resulting in a lower fuel flow.
Decreasing air temperature will compensate for the decrease in air density by decreasing the pressure, leaving the fuel flow unchanged.
Decreasing air temperature over-compensates for the decrease in air density by decreasing the pressure, resulting in a lower fuel flow.
Due to decreasing air density with altitude, the reduced power output has to be compensated by a higher fuel flow.

variant.question: Regarding the thrust required and thrust available for a jet engine aircraft, which of the following statements is true? During the...

options.text: descent, the maximum range is achieved when flying at the maximum thrust required.
cruise, the maximum range is achieved when flying with the minimum thrust required.
cruise, the maximum speed is only limited by the thrust available.
climb, the maximum angle is achieved when flying with the minimum thrust required.

variant.question: If a jet aircraft experiences a temperature drop of 5ºC during flight, what will happen to its range?

options.text: Range will decrease.
Range stays the same, SFC will decrease.
Range stays the same, SFC will increase.
Range will increase.
